thag4.10:1.1_0: “Dhamma surely protects one who practices Dhamma;
thag4.10:1.2_0: The teaching brings happiness when practiced well.
thag4.10:1.3_0: This is the benefit of practicing Dhamma:
thag4.10:1.4_0: one doesn’t go to a bad destination.
thag4.10:2.1_0: It’s not the case that Dhamma and what is not Dhamma
thag4.10:2.3_0: What is not Dhamma leads to hell,
thag4.10:2.4_0: while Dhamma takes you to a good place.
thag4.10:3.1_0: So you should rouse enthusiasm for the teachings;
thag4.10:3.2_0: such rejoicing is owing to the Holy One, the poised.
thag4.10:3.3_0: The disciples of the best of Holy Ones are firm in the teaching;
thag4.10:3.4_0: those wise ones are led on, headed to the very best of refuges.”
thag4.10:4.2_0: the net of craving is eradicated.
thag4.10:4.3_0: He’s ended at peace, but doesn’t think about nothing.
thag4.10:4.4_0: like the moon on the fifteenth day.
